Welcome to MantraFootball!

We invite you to join the trial tournament for 7 rounds. The top 5 European leagues are available for selection. Participation in the trial tournament is free. Register!

about.paragraph1: In 2017, the project started among the Lviv fans of AC Milan as a classic fantasy football with one Serie A league for 5 players.
about.paragraph2: Since 2018, the Premier League has been launched according to the rules that have already been tested in practice, and 2 leagues for this tournament have appeared in the project. Since then, we have been expanding every year. Thus, in the 20/21 season, a tournament based on the Bundesliga started for the first time, and in the 21/22 season - La Liga and Ligue 1. In the 22/23 season, we add Belgium, the Netherlands, Portugal and the Championship to the list of available leagues.
about.paragraph3: In addition, according to slightly changed rules, we organize tournaments based on Champions League, European Championship and League of Nations. A tournament based on the World Cup in Qatar is planned.
about.paragraph4: In 2022, we still remain a project of like-minded people who have combined their professional skills (designers, marketers, developers, etc.) for the development of Ukrainian football fantasy.
about.subtitle: MantraFootball is an adaptation of the Italian fantasy football system.
about.title: About Us

fee.discount1_note: (who has not yet played a full season in the Mantra)
fee.discount2_note: (who paid to participate in at least one league)
fee.discount4_note: (which you did not play last season)
fee.note: Possible fees in US dollars at the rate of $1 = 40‚Ç¥
fee.paragraph1: For the game you need to make an organizational fee. These funds cover the cost of the site infrastructure (server use) and the award to the winners.
fee.paragraph2: Also, the fee is a guarantee that the player will not leave the game in the middle of the season, because in this case it will harm other league members (departure of a member in the H2H system negatively affects the intrigue in the league).
fee.paragraph3: The amount of the fee depends on the popularity of the league.
fee.subtitle1: Whether you are a new player or an existing one.
fee.subtitle2: The amount of our fees is available to everyone.
fee.title: Organizational fees

guide.rules: You can read the detailed rules of the game on
guide.ul01: We form a league of 8 managers (if you want to be together with a friend - let us know and we will take it into account).
guide.ul02: We hold an auction where managers form their teams of 26 players. Each football player can be in the team of only one manager of the league - the one who paid the most for him. You can sell and buy new players to the team only in transfer windows.
guide.ul03: All football players are divided into 11 unique positions in which they can perform (some players can play in several positions).
guide.ul04: Every round, the manager chooses the scheme for the game, the lineup of 11 main players and the bench (all schemes are balanced and usually include, in addition to the goalkeeper, 5 defensive and 5 attacking positions).
guide.ul05: The game takes place in the Head to Head system, that is, in each round you face one of the opposing managers.
guide.ul06: The start of the Round (deadline for creating the lineup) is 1.5 hours before the first match of the tour (the round always coincides with the round of the calendar, if any match of the tour was not played due to postponement, then this round is not closed, but is waiting for completion). We do not have any 'paired' tours.
guide.ul07: Based on the results of real matches, players are awarded not only bonuses and penalties for their actions, but also a Base rating. A third-party statistical resource assigns this rating to a player based on his actions in a real match. We use Fotmob as such a resource.
guide.ul08: If the player did not play in the real Tour, he can be replaced by someone from the bench who can play in this position.
guide.ul09: The basic scores of the main players, as well as maluses and bonuses, are added up and converted into game goals according to the principle: 72 points - 1 goal, each subsequent goal - for an additional 7 points.
guide.ul10: The team that scored more goals in the match wins it. 3 points are awarded for a win, 1 for a draw. The tournament table is formed on the basis of these points.
guide.ul11: The team with the most points at the end of the tournament wins the league and the trophy.

better.item1_text: Only one opponent to beat each gameweek
better.item2_text: Up to 10 participants in the league
better.item3_text: Player is only for one team in the league (no Salah for everyone üòé)
better.item4_text: Manager should gather the team using limited budget
better.item5_text: Player's score is based on personal performance plus bonuses and maluses
better.item6_text: Players use their real positions. There are 11 positions in Mantra
better.item7_text: Goalkeeper, defender or winger? Does not matter, each can bring a victory!

what_is.subtitle: It's a football game in which you create a virtual team of real players to win a tournament

auction.header2: How is a blind auction conducted?
auction.header4: Minimum prices at the blind auction

note.ol1: Before the auction, we recommend that you familiarize yourself with the available game modules (schemes of the placement of players) and form the composition of your team taking into account the necessary positions.
note.ol2: Any pre-arrangements between multiple managers regarding the players they have selected and the price offered for them (before the results of the next round of the auction are revealed) are considered fair play and are strictly prohibited by the community.
note.ol3: During one transfer window, the manager cannot re-acquire a player he sold.

auction.paragraph1: A live auction is a meeting of all league managers (more often online, less often offline) who bid for players in real time and with an open bid. On average, a live auction lasts 4 hours (such an auction takes place only at the request of all league managers and the administrator's consent).
auction.paragraph2: Each manager in turn names a football player for whom he is ready to pay at least 1 million from his budget. After that, the other managers can (but are not required to) make their bid. Each subsequent bet must be greater than the previous one by at least one step. The rate step is determined by the current rate. If the current rate is in the range from 1 to 19 - the minimum step is 1 million, in the range of 20-29 - 2 million, in the range of 30-39 - 3 million and so on. If no one has exceeded the current bet within 10 seconds, the player is considered sold.
auction.paragraph3: The blind auction is the primary format used for team building because it does not require all managers to be online or offline at a pre-arranged time.
auction.paragraph4: Additional auctions are provided to make changes to the composition of the teams, exclude injured players or those who lost their place in the team during the season.
auction.paragraph5: Additional auctions, unlike the starting one, are held according to the following principle:
auction.paragraph6: At the first stage of the starting auction, some football players (about 50) have their minimum bet. These minimum bids apply ONLY at the first stage of the auction and are aimed at making the team composition more balanced.
auction.paragraph7: Players will have a minimum price if they played 13+ matches last season in this league and were ranked in the top 5 players of the league in their position or had an average total score of 8.0+ last season.

screen1.text: Here you can see the course of the auction for Eden Hazard
screen1.title: Auction page

auction.title: Auction
auction.ul01: The formation of teams in the league takes place according to the results of the auction.
auction.ul02: The starting auction is held before the start of the season, but managers will subsequently have the opportunity to change their team squad in additional auctions that will take place at specific times ('transfer windows') throughout the season.
auction.ul03: Each manager, before the starting auction, receives a budget of 260 million to buy players.
auction.ul04: Each team must consist of 26 players (of which at least 3 must be goalkeepers).
auction.ul05: Teams are formed from real players of the selected football championship.
auction.ul06: Each player is unique and can only be represented by one team in the league.
auction.ul07: There are no restrictions on the number of representatives of one football club in one team.
auction.ul08: Incoming transfers outside the transfer windows are not provided.
auction.ul09: There are two types of auction: blind (default) and live.
auction.ul11: The blind auction takes place online directly on the MantraFootball website in several stages.
auction.ul12: At the first stage, all managers have access to a list of all the players of the respective football championship.
auction.ul13: Each manager needs to select 26 players (minimum 3 of which are goalkeepers) and divide their starting budget (260 million) between them.
auction.ul14: The minimum bid is 1 million per selected player (except for the exceptions described below). The maximum bid is limited only by the total budget.
auction.ul15: The bid is an integer multiple of 1 (where 1 means 1 million).
auction.ul16: Each stage of the auction ends when all managers in the league have confirmed their bids, or at a predetermined deadline, after which the system automatically compares the bids made by all managers.
auction.ul17: The manager who placed the highest bid on a certain player takes him to his team, automatically reducing his budget by the amount of the bid placed on this player.
auction.ul18: If the manager failed to purchase the player, the amount of the bid on him is returned to the budget.
auction.ul19: If several managers have placed an equal bid on a certain player, and no one has exceeded this bid, such a player is considered unsold and remains available for purchase by any manager in the following stages of the auction (and the bids placed on him are returned).
auction.ul20: The stages of the auction are repeated until all managers have fully formed their teams of 26 players.
auction.ul21: Until the end of the next round of the auction, managers should not know which players other managers have selected and what bids they have placed.
auction.ul31: During the transfer window (after its announcement and before the deadline), the manager can select several players from his team to sell.
auction.ul32: The amount that was previously paid by the manager for this player is returned to his budget, and the player himself becomes a free agent. Such a player will be available for purchase by any other league manager other than the one who sold him. The manager who sold the player will not be able to buy him until the next transfer window.
auction.ul33: During the season, the transfer window opens 4 times. The exact schedule can be found in the 'Auctions' menu of the league after it is created. The approximate schedule is as follows: I ‚Äì the first half of September, II ‚Äì the second half of November, III ‚Äì the first half of February, IV ‚Äì the second half of March.
auction.ul34: The number of players that can be sold in the top 5 tournaments (EPL, Serie A, Bundesliga, Ligue 1, LaLiga): 3 players for each window in divisions A and B, for division C - 4 players, for divisions D and below - 5 players. For other tournaments, the number of slots in each auction is 5.
auction.ul35: A player who left the championship (due to transfer, early termination of the contract, etc.) leaves the team on his own and the amount paid for him is returned to the manager's budget.
auction.ul36: A player who has changed clubs within one tournament does not leave the Mantra team.
auction.ul37: Additional auctions are always conducted in a blind format.
auction.ul38: It is not possible to buy and sell players outside the transfer windows, except for one exception: if the team has only 1 goalkeeper left as a result of the transfer. In this case, another goalkeeper of the same club, whose goalkeeper remained in the squad, joins the team. After the opening of the transfer window, the manager will be able to sell this player according to the sales rules.

basic.ol1: We form a league of 6-10 managers.
basic.ol2: We hold an auction where managers form their own team.
basic.ol3: For each round, the manager chooses a team of 11 major players under certain tactics, and also forms a bench.
basic.ol4: After real matches, players are awarded a score and bonuses / maluses for their actions in matches.
basic.ol5: The sum of all players' points is converted into team goals.
basic.ol6: A team earns tournament points if it scores no less than the opponent's team.
basic.ol7: The team with the most points in the league wins the cup.
basic.paragraph1: Leagues are formed on the basis of submitted applications, where you indicate in which tournaments you want to play. Managers' wishes are taken into account - you can create a league with your friends or join other members.
basic.paragraph2: The composition of the league does not change during the season.
basic.paragraph3: Each tournament can have several leagues in which you can participate.
basic.title: Basic
basic.ul1: Uniqueness of players - each player will be unique in the league and will only bring points one team.
basic.ul2: Emphasis on the functions of the manager - you will feel like a real football coach who 'puzzles' over who to put in the starting lineup.
basic.ul3: An active part of the game is tactics - which module to choose: 4-4-2 or 3-4-3, who to put on the bench, and who will not get into the lineup?
basic.ul4: Dynamics from round to round - you can rely on some performers of this matchday, but next time they will not bring so many bonuses.
basic.ul5: Great community of participants with whom you can discuss all the events in the world of football or to argue about which championship stronger?

example.paragraph4: The average value of 7.425 is converted into a defence bonus of 2 points.
example.paragraph5: The goalkeeper's score is not taken into account when calculating the defense bonus.
example.remark1: If Gundogan (with his native position CM) had played in the module in place of McGinn, he would not have claimed clean sheet.
example.remark2: Silva (with his native position W) cannot count on a clean sheet.
example.remark3: -1 x 3 (per missed goal) and -0.5 (for yellow card)

note.ol1: In the event of a sending off, the outfield player only receives a clean sheet bonus if his club has not conceded a single goal until the end of the match.
note.ol2: If the goalkeeper receives a red card, he does not receive the bonus for the clean sheet.
note.ol3: Removing a player from the bench after being substituted for the clean sheet has no effect.
note.ol4: The size of the clean sheet bonus cannot be higher than that provided for the position in which the player is in the module (for example, if a player with the 'native' positions of RB and WB is in the module in the WB position, his clean sheet bonus will be +0.5). And vice versa: if a player finds himself in a module in a 'non-native' position, he can receive a clean sheet bonus, the size of which does not exceed the bonus of his 'native' position (for example, the size of the clean sheet bonus of a player with a 'native' DM position, who play at the CB position in the module, will be +0.5).
note.ol5: When determining the author of a goal, assist, own goal, penalty kick, etc., the indicator of the FotMob service is taken into account, which should record and display the relevant fact. Indicators of other football portals and services are not taken into account.
note.ol6: A missed penalty is not necessarily a goalkeeper save, therefore, the goalkeeper does not receive the corresponding bonus for all missed penalties.

bonuses.paragraph1: In addition to the basic score, players can receive additional bonuses for certain positive actions and maluses for negative ones.
bonuses.paragraph10: Only the goalkeeper receives malus for missed goals, including penalties.
bonuses.paragraph11: If certain players of the main team did not play in their match, and among the substitutes there is no player with a corresponding 'native' position, then he is replaced by a player of another position with the lowest malus (at first, a reserve player with a -1.5 malus is chosen, and in the absence of such a player - with a malus - 3).
bonuses.paragraph12: The replacement algorithm is described in detail in
bonuses.paragraph14: The manager can also deliberately assign a player to a 'non-native' position in the main squad.
bonuses.paragraph15: In MantraFootball, the following matrix of malus by positions is used:
bonuses.paragraph16: To increase the value of defenders, MantraFootball has an additional defense bonus. Its size is calculated based on the average value of the defenders' basic scores (before taking into account bonuses and maluses).
bonuses.paragraph17: The result is converted into additional points for the team:
bonuses.paragraph2: The size of the bonus for a scored goal depends on the 'native' position of the player:
bonuses.paragraph20: is used for UPL due to the lack of scores on Fotmob, the principle of 6.00+0.25 is used when calculating UPL results (6.00-6.24 - +1 point, etc.).
bonuses.paragraph3: The size of the bonus for a player's goal depends precisely on his 'native' positions, and not on the position in which the player 'played' in the MantraFootball module.
bonuses.paragraph4: The size of the bonus for a scored penalty does not depend on the position of the player.
bonuses.paragraph5: Only the goalkeeper can get this bonus. The size of the bonus depends on the number of saves:
bonuses.paragraph6: The size of the clean sheet bonus depends on the player's position:
bonuses.paragraph7: To receive a bonus for clean sheet, a player must meet the following criteria at the same time:
bonuses.paragraph8: For a direct red card, the field player receives a minus -2, and the goalkeeper -3. Similarly, for removal due to two yellow cards.
bonuses.paragraph9: However, if an outfield player who has already received a yellow card receives a direct red card, his malus will be -2.5 and for the goalkeeper -3.5.

screen1.text: Shows the malus depending on the native position of the player and the position in the module
screen1.title: Position malus table

bonuses.title: Bonuses / Maluses
bonuses.ul01: +2 if ST position is among the player's 'native' positions
bonuses.ul02: +2.5 if FW position is among the player's 'native' positions
bonuses.ul04: +1 if the goalkeeper saves 6 or more shots
bonuses.ul05: +0.5 if the goalkeeper saves 3 to 5 shots
bonuses.ul14: Have a 'native' position corresponding to one of the above.
bonuses.ul15: To be placed in the module in one of the positions listed above.
bonuses.ul16: Play at least 60 minutes in a real match of his club according to data from FotMob.
bonuses.ul17: During the player's stay on the field, his club did not miss a single goal.

calculation.paragraph1: The sum of points scored by the 11 main players of the team is converted into team goals as follows:
calculation.paragraph2: And so on, every extra 7 points of the team is a +1 goal to the total score.
calculation.paragraph5: is used for UPL due to the lack of scores on Fotmob, the 60+6 principle is used when calculating UPL results (60 points - 1 goal, +6 points - each subsequent one). In this case, the protection bonus starts at 6.00
calculation.paragraph6: The team that scores more goals in a league match wins.
calculation.paragraph7: The standings are formed on the basis of team points
calculation.paragraph8: In case of equality of team points, the team with the most goals scored is placed higher. In the case of equality of this indicator, the team with more victories also has an advantage. In the event of a tie, the next indicators for comparison are the total score and the total score in head-to-head matches.
calculation.title: Calculation of results

note.ol1: If a team plays in the lowest division of the championship, it is not relegated from it even after taking a place in the relegation zone.
note.ol2: The number of teams relegated to a lower division may vary if not all leagues are recruited in the lower division.

divisions.paragraph1: According to the results of the competition, the champion of each league that has played a full season receives a championship trophy.
divisions.paragraph2: At the end of the season, the teams at the top of the table (marked in green on the Division Map) are promoted to the higher divisions, and the teams at the bottom of the table (marked in red) are relegated to the lower divisions.
divisions.paragraph3: In order to ensure fair play, the manager may be deprived of the opportunity to lead his team.
divisions.paragraph4: The procedure for dismissing the manager from the team:
divisions.paragraph5: Members of the league can leave an application for verification of a separate league outside the period of 7 rounds.

screen1.text: Green places - promotion to a higher division, red - relegation to a lower one
screen1.title: Divisions map

divisions.title: Divisions
divisions.ul01: Every 7 rounds, the administrators check all MantraFootball leagues for teams whose managers have not fielded a line-up for 4 or more rounds.
divisions.ul02: If such teams are found, administrators contact such a manager.
divisions.ul03: If the manager declares that he wants to play further, then he is given a trial period - 3 rounds.
divisions.ul04: If this manager does not field a lineup in the future, the other managers of the league conduct a closed vote to replace the manager for that team.
divisions.ul05: If the majority vote for a replacement, the administrators look for a new manager for that team.

fanta.ol1: Total score - the sum of points scored by the manager during the season.
fanta.ol2: Scoring according to the biathlon system - points are awarded to the 40 best teams of each game round. The manager who scored the most points on the game day gets 60 points, the second result - 54 points, and so on: 48, 43, 40, 38, 36, 34, 32, 31... 2, 1 respectively.
fanta.ol3: The best lineup for all game days of the tournament (by the amount of points scored during one game day).
fanta.paragraph1: In addition to the classic Mantra leagues, for the Euro, World Cup and Champions League we have another format of the tournament - Fanta.
fanta.paragraph2: In Fanta tournaments there are 3 prize competitions:

screen1.text: An example of the squad in the Fanta-type tournament
screen1.title: Fanta squad

screen2.text: An example of the table in the Fanta-type tournament
screen2.title: Fanta table

fanta.title: Fanta
fanta.ul1: No auction: coaches each game day select 11 players from a list of teams playing that day under any module of their choice.
fanta.ul2: Players in different managers' teams may be repeated, but there are no substitutes.
fanta.ul3: There are limits on the number of players from one team on a particular game day (depends on the number of real teams playing that day).

lineup.paragraph1: When selecting a lineup for a round, the manager selects a module to play (drop-down list near 3-4-3 in the image) and players for each position and substitution. To assign a player to a position, click on the corresponding slot in the list displayed in the right half of the screen.
lineup.paragraph2: Once clicked, a pop-up window will appear with a list of players available for assignment to the respective position.
lineup.paragraph3: The list of players is formed according to the following principle:
lineup.paragraph4: For the convenience of choosing players, the following information is provided:
lineup.paragraph5: When choosing a player with a position malus, after maintaining the composition, he will be indicated by a yellow triangle with an exclamation mark:

screen1.text: This is the place where you can select your squad for current Round
screen1.title: Lineup page

screen2.text: This step will help you to choose best option for selected position
screen2.title: Player selection

lineup.title: Lineup selection
lineup.ul00: the first block shows the players who can 'play' in the corresponding position without a malus (in the example below: Gueye, Sissoko and Verratti).
lineup.ul01: the second block displays players who can 'play' in the corresponding position with -1.5 points malus (in the example below: Kamara)
lineup.ul02: the third block displays players who can 'play' in the corresponding position with a -3 points malus (in the example below: Payet, Majer and Reine-Adelaide)
lineup.ul14: the logo of the club against which the player's team will play their next match
lineup.ul15: H (Home) or A (Away), which indicates where the player's team will play their next match

modules.paragraph1: The first stage of forming a team for a certain round is the selection of a module that determines the layout of the players of his team.
modules.paragraph2: The system will suggest a default module that you can change.
modules.paragraph3: In total, there are 11 modules in the system:
modules.paragraph4: Some modules allow a positional alternative, such as WB/W. This means that a player of both one (WB) and another (W) position can be placed in the corresponding place without any malus (penalties).
modules.title: Modules

player_score.paragraph1: Player score consists of several elements:
player_score.paragraph2: A base score is an assessment of a player's performance in a specific match, which is provided by a statistical resource
player_score.paragraph3: The starting score of the player from FotMob is 6 points. Depending on the success on the playing field, his score may increase (to a maximum of 10 points) or decrease (to a minimum of 0 points).
player_score.paragraph4: MantraFootball uses the final score generated by FotMob at the end of the match as the player's base score.
player_score.paragraph5: After the end of the match, FotMob can change the basic scores both downward and upward for a certain time. The final base scores are considered to be those formed at the time of closing the round (approximately 12 hours after the final whistle of the last match of the tour).
player_score.paragraph6: If the player started the match in the starting lineup, then, with rare exceptions, FotMob will give him a score. However, FotMob's algorithms do not evaluate players who entered the field after 80 minutes of regular time. MantraFootball automatically assigns such players a base score of 6 points.
player_score.paragraph7: Bonuses and malus are described in detail in
player_score.paragraph9: A player's total score in MantraFootball is based on the base score, taking into account all applicable bonuses and maluses.
player_score.title: Player Score

note.ol1: The 'native' positions of players in the Mantra fantasy football database remain unchanged throughout the season and do not always coincide with the positions of these players indicated on other football resources.
note.ol2: The characteristic 'left/right' applies only to the position of full-back and does not apply to the positions of midfielder, winger, etc.
note.ol3: The source for determining the 'native' positions is the historical data of the Transfermarkt resource and the subjective methodology of the MantraFootball administration.
note.ol4: We strongly encourage managers to submit requests for (in their opinion) discrepancies between Mantra positions and actual player positions. Such requests are considered during the break between seasons.

positions.paragraph1: The main characteristic of each player is one or more 'native' game positions in which he can play. There are a total of 11 game positions in the Mantra fantasy football system:
positions.remark: * - position name according to the italian naming
positions.title: Players positions
positions.ul00: If a player has more than one game position in their profile, they can play any of them in the
positions.ul01: Players of some positions may be assigned to a 'non-native' position for them with the application of
positions.ul02: The player's position chosen by the manager may not coincide with the position in which this player will play in the real match (this does not affect the calculation of points).

note.ol1: If the manager does not create his lineup by the deadline, the system will automatically copy the module and player lineup for him from the previous game round (without taking into account the substitutions made).

round.paragraph1: The Mantra football season consists of game rounds that completely coincide with the calendar rounds of the real football championship.

screen1.text: Here you can review your lineup and progress against the opponent.
screen1.title: Match center

round.title: Game Round
round.ul00_1: To participate in the game round, the manager must first choose
round.ul00_3: which will determine the layout of his team's players.
round.ul01_1: According to the selected module, having a team of 26 players at his disposal, the manager determines 11 players of
round.ul02: The deadline for choosing the team coincides 1.5 hours before the start of the first match of the corresponding round of the real football championship. After the deadline, the manager cannot change his chosen module and player composition.
round.ul03: The main goal of every manager is to 'score' more goals to the opponent than he 'scores' in return.
round.ul04_1: The number of goals scored is determined based on
round.ul04_3: of all players, taking into account
round.ul05_1: To determine the basic score of a player's performance in a specific match,
round.ul06: The game round completely coincides with the calendar round of the tournament and ends only after all the matches of the corresponding round of the real football championship have been played. If one or more matches have not been played in a certain round (for example, a match has been postponed to another date), the game round is not completed until such matches are played.

substitution.paragraph1: In addition to the 11 players of the main team, the manager chooses 9 substitutes, among whom there must be at least 1 goalkeeper.
substitution.paragraph2: Substitute players are meant to replace main players who have not played in their club's respective match in the real football tournament.
substitution.paragraph3: Substitutions take place according to the following rules:
substitution.paragraph4: Substitutions are a complex mechanism, they are not performed separately, but are carried out in such a way as to carry out the maximum possible number of substitutions without malus and the maximum possible number of substitutions in general (taking into account the principle of minimization of malus).
substitution.paragraph5: Since substitutions are affected by the order in which the players are on the bench (the higher the player, the higher priority he has), the best substitution option is the player with the smallest malus and the highest priority for making the necessary substitutions.
substitution.paragraph6: If there are several alternative options for substitutions with the same malus, caused solely by the order of substitutions, priority is given to the option for which the substitute with a higher position on the bench will take the place in the main squad.
substitution.paragraph7: In the absence of other reservations, substitutions are made from top to bottom - from goalkeepers to forwards.
substitution.paragraph8: The concept of substitutions does not allow substitution of players of the main squad among themselves. That is, if a player of the main team did not play, he can only be replaced by a player from the substitution list (and not another player of the main team who could play in this position).
substitution.paragraph9: The procedure for determining malus per position is described in detail in

screen1.text: An example of substitutes after a game - Donnarumma replaced Navas, and Kolo Muani replaced Messi
screen1.title: Substitutions

substitution.title: Substitutions
substitution.ul00: If a player of the main team did not play a match, he is replaced by a substitute player who has the required playing position.
substitution.ul01: If among the substitute players there are several players who can be replaced by position - preference is given to the player who is higher in the list of substitutes (the order of players on the bench is the order of priority).
substitution.ul02: If there is no player with the required playing position in the list of reserve players, a player whose position allows for a substitution with a malus of -1.5 points is substituted.
substitution.ul03: If there is no player in the list of reserve players, whose position allows for a substitution with a malus of -1.5 points, then a player whose position allows for a substitution with a malus of -3 points is substituted.
substitution.ul04: The maximum possible number of substitutions in a tour for one team is 9.
substitution.ul05: If there are no substitute players on the list who can be substituted with a malus, the substitution does not take place, and the corresponding position remains empty (as a rule, this situation is the worst for the manager, therefore, when choosing a lineup, we recommend carefully studying the probability of the appearance of the corresponding player in a real match).

rules.subtitle: Mantra is a fantasy football system that came to us from Italy and is aimed at those who want to immerse themselves in the game, as well as emphasizes the value of each player's choice.
rules.subtitle1: Fantasy football is a game in which users form a virtual team of real football players and, depending on their performances, score points.
rules.subtitle2: Mantra is our reinterpretation of fantasy, a kind of advance level where we changed everything that pissed us off in the classic one.
rules.subtitle3: And it's a great way to have fun with friends and find new ones!
rules.subtitle4: After the start of the game, each match of your player acquires a new meaning.
rules.title: Rules
